com.github.tilastokeskus.matertis.core

Class Tetromino

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.tilastokeskus.matertis.core.Tetromino

  • public class Tetromino
extends Object
    Represents a tetromino. All tetrominoes have the functionality to be moved and rotated.
    Author:
    tilastokeskus

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tetromino

        public Tetromino(int[][] layout,
         int colorHex)
        Constructs a tetromino with the given colorHex and layout. The layout of the tetromino should be a square matrix, with a cell of the tetromino represented as 1, and empty cell represented as 0.

        The tetromino L as an example: 

          1 0 0
  1 1 1
  0 0 0
        Parameters:
        layout - a square matrix representing the layout of the tetromino.
        colorHex - a hexadecimal color value that should be used when drawing this tetromino.

      • Tetromino

        public Tetromino(Tetromino t)

      • rotateCW

        public void rotateCW()
        Rotates the tetromino's layout 90 degrees clockwise.

        The rotating algorithm guarantees O(n^2) time complexity and O(1) space complexity, n being the width or height of the tetromino's layout.

        The algorithm works by rotating each layer of the layout. A layer is rotated by choosing 4 elements, one from each of the layout's sides, and swapping them with each other in a clockwise manner. This happens until the whole layer has been rotated.

        See Also:
        rotateCCW

      • rotateCCW

        public void rotateCCW()
        Rotates the tetromino's layout 90 degrees counterclockwise. This is a mirrored version of the rotateCW method.
        See Also:
        rotateCW
